meanings.definition: A line or sequence of people or vehicles waiting their turn.
meanings.sent1: The queues at the amusement park were long but moved quickly.
meanings.sent2: I stood in the queue at the grocery store to pay for my items.
meanings.sent3: The queues at the ice cream shop were so long that people started doing the conga while waiting.
meanings.sent4: The queues of cars on the highway resembled colorful ribbons weaving through the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The queues outside the concert venue stretched for blocks, filled with excited fans.

meanings.definition: To form or join a line or sequence.
meanings.sent1: She queues up early every morning to get the freshest bread from the bakery.
meanings.sent2: We need to queue in an orderly manner to board the bus.
meanings.sent3: The ducks in the pond decided to queue behind the biggest duck, thinking it was the leader.
meanings.sent4: The students queued outside the library, eager to borrow the latest bestseller.
meanings.sent5: The ants queued up in a straight line, carrying food back to their nest.
